title: Woman charged over hospital sabotage rampage | 7NEWS
description: A 42-year-old woman has been charged with allegedly sabotaging critical infrastructure at two Sydney hospitals, cutting water and gas supplies at Kareena Private Hospital before scaling a wall to enter Sutherland Hospital and switching off medical gas mains including oxygen supplies to patients. The incident, which occurred just after midnight, has prompted a NSW Health review into hospital security after the woman, who was on bail, was able to access highly restricted areas with apparent knowledge of what she was targeting. title: Two killed in Cobar mine explosion | 7NEWS
description: Two workers have been killed and another seriously injured in an explosion at the Endeavour silver-zinc mine near Cobar in far western New South Wales. Holly Clarke, 24, and Patrick McMullen, 66, died when explosives unexpectedly detonated at 3:45am during a routine evening shift, while survivor Mackenzie Sterling remains hospitalised in stable condition. The mine, operated by Polymetals since 2023, has been closed pending investigation into the catastrophic safety system failure. title: Western Sydney Airport's historic first jet landing | 7NEWS
description: Western Sydney Airport conducts its first passenger jet landing as part of a full-scale emergency disaster simulation, marking a major milestone 80 years after the airport was first proposed and seven years after construction began. The Boeing 737 air tanker from the Rural Fire Service fleet successfully touched down on runway 05, with 300 rescue workers participating in the rehearsal ahead of the airport's opening next year. The 24-hour international airport aims to carry up to 10 million passengers annually, though concerns remain about attracting sufficient airline interest with only QantasLink, Jetstar, Singapore Airlines and Air New Zealand signed up so far. title: Porsche splits in half in Gordon crash | 7NEWS
description: A white Porsche crashed across the median strip on Ryde Road at Gordon during peak hour, splitting in half and hitting a Land Rover containing a mother and teenage daughter, plus a third vehicle. The 40-year-old Porsche driver has not been charged, and remarkably no one was seriously injured despite the dramatic nature of the collision. title: Cruise passenger dies after being left on remote island | 7NEWS
description: An 81-year-old cruise ship passenger died after being left behind on Lizard Island, a remote location on the Great Barrier Reef 1600 kilometres north of Brisbane. The woman was hiking a bush trail when she became tired and turned back, but the Coral Adventurer departed without realising she wasn't on board, leading to a five-hour delay before a search began. Her body was found 50 metres from the hiking trail on Sunday, raising questions about safety procedures and whether the tragedy could have been prevented. title: Albanese wraps up ASEAN diplomatic tour | 7NEWS
description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese conducts diplomatic meetings with Southeast Asian leaders during his visit to Kuala Lumpur for ASEAN summit. Albanese will depart for South Korea tomorrow to attend the APEC meeting. title: Police seize $63 million cocaine shipment | 7NEWS
description: State and Federal police have seized 128 kilograms of cocaine worth $63 million in Condell Park, arresting two men allegedly connected to the KVT criminal syndicate. The drug importation bust emerged during investigations into a July drive-by shooting at Concord, with police linking the cocaine shipment to recent public place shootings across Sydney. The arrested men, who were once associated with the Alameddine crime family but are now at war with them, face life imprisonment and will appear in court again in January. title: Telco fines tripled to $30 million after deadly Optus outage | 7NEWS
description: Telecommunications companies face increased fines of up to $30 million per breach for network outages following last month's Optus failure that was linked to at least three deaths. The government has mandated new requirements for telcos to establish public registers on their websites for real-time outage notifications, while opposition parties prepare to force a Senate inquiry into the incident. title: Hurricane Melissa threatens Jamaica with category 5 fury | 7NEWS
description: Hurricane Melissa, a maximum strength Category 5 storm with winds up to 282 kilometres per hour, is approaching Jamaica as the strongest storm of 2025.
